text:
<@U025WLMJ60H> discuss what the horizon for selling (or maybe even IPO’ing) is for the company, and see if that aligns with your personal goals/ambitions. Whatever they answer, ask them how they’d get there, what’s required, how many investment rounds (in which you’ll dilute) are required etc. Try to get a good picture of what the future value of the equity could be worth.

Unless we’re talking FAANG companies, the equity should have WAY more value than whatever you could get on the stock market. Startup equity is high risk, high reward.
